resources.string: Welcome to TGuide!\nUse this space to keep your notes.
Use this space to keep any notes you may have.
Click on the button bellow to create a reminder!

Turner Syndrome is a condition that affects only girls and women. Most people have 23 pairs of chromosomes, with 1 pair being sex chromoses. Most males have an X and Y sex chromosome and most females have two X chromosomes. In turner syndrome, there is an absence of all or part of the second X chromosome in some or all of the cells of the body.
Are there different types of Turner Syndrome?

There are multiple types of Turner Syndrome. Females who are completely missing an X chromosome have "classic" Turner Syndrom. Others are missing only part of the second X chromosome or have structural rearrangements of the chromosome. In some females, only some cells are missing the X chromosome, known as a mosaic karyotype. Knowing your type is important because each type is assocaited with different health issues.
Why is it important to know if someone has Turner Syndrome?

Missing part of or all of one X chromosome is associated with a range of health, development, social and learning challenges which affects females with Turner Syndrome to different extends. It is important to diagnosis Turner Syndrome as early as possible so that your health care provider can determine whether you have health issues that need to be treated or watched.

Turner Syndrome is not a disease, but a genetic condition that is associated with a range of health concerns. Turner Syndrome is not directly treated by a health care provider, but the individual health concerns that arive are monitered and treated. New medical developments allow women with TS who are interested in starting a family to seek the help of an obstetrician who specializes in in-vitro fertilization. A girl with Turner Syndrome may get growth horomone under the supervision of a pediartric endocrinologist.

McMaster University is co-educational, and has over 25,000 undergraduate and over 4,000 post-graduate students.[10] Alumni and former students reside across Canada and in 139 countries.[3] Notable alumni include government officials, academics, business $405,300 per faculty member, the highest in Canada.

Reflection and meditation can help to reduce stress and anxiety. It is a great way to see how you are doing and how you are doing. Try taking a few minutes out of your day to see how you are doing. Some questions to think about are; 

	 How have you been doing recently? 
	 Are taking care of yourself physically? 
	 What about Mentally? 
	 Do you feel stressed? How come? 
	 Do you feel supported? 
	 Do changes need to be made in your life? 
	 Are you content 

Try using this audio as a guide to help you with your reflection and medititation practice.

Use this space as a way to keep track of when you need to schedule appoints. Just click on the appointment and enter when your appointment is or was. Then text will turn red when it is time to book another appointment. \n\nYou can download a PDF version of the table below.
